goal.en: "This course is focusing on discussing the variability of X-ray binaries. Variability of X-ray binaries provides us fruitful information to understand the properties of these sources, including the nature of compact object, accretion disk and close binary’s properties. The variability can be periodic, quasi-periodic or even aperiodic with time scale less than millisecond to thousands of days, about 12 order of magnitudes’ difference. The variation amplitude may be as small as a few percent to about a factor of thousands. Various time scales’ modulations allow us to study different part of a binary system. I will select some interesting topics for discussions in this course."

content.en:
"The followings are the potential topics to discuss in this course:
I. Data analysis methods
Analysis for time series; Fourier transform; LS periodogram; Phase and Folding the light curves; PDM; Epoch folding searching; O-C method; Analysis for event list; Z-test and H-test
II. Orbital variations
Orbital period and its derivative; Total eclipsing sources; Partial eclipsing sources; Dipping sources; Other orbital modulations in X-ray band; Orbital modulation in optical band; ellipsoidal modulation; Orbital Doppler effect; Coupling of orbital variation and disk motion; Superhump in low mass X-ray binaries
III. Long-term modulations
Super-orbital modulation; Disk dynamics; Triple system; Data analysis method – dynamic power spectrum and HHT; Stability of super-orbital modulations
IV. Transient events in X-ray binaries
Transient X-ray binaries; Outbursts; Disk instability model; Be X-ray binaries; X-ray bursts; Relativistic jet in X-ray binaries and microquasar
V. Quasi-periodic modulation (QPO)
QPO and kilohertz QPO; QPO in black hole binaries; Burst QPO and spin frequency of neutron star
VI. Pulsars in X-ray binaries
Verifying neutron star in X-ray binaries; Rotation and accretion powered pulsars; Millisecond pulsars in radio band and low mass X-ray binaries; Accreting millisecond X-ray pulsars; Accretion torque and time noise in accreting millisecond X-ray pulsars"
